question: The Finance Ministry recently asked the CPSEs for issuance of “bonus shares” to prevent “fiscal crunch”. Which of the following best defines “bonus shares”?
option1: Bonus shares are additional shares given to the existing shareholders of a company without any additional cost.
option2: Bonus shares are additional shares issued at prices above the par value of shares to existing shareholders.
option3: Bonus shares are shares issued at discount on par value of shares to add new shareholders in a company.
option4: Bonus shares are issued at discount on par value of shares with promise to redeem at fixed dividend rate.
answer: Bonus shares are additional shares given to the existing shareholders of a company without any additional cost.
explanation: Bonus shares are gifts to existing shareholders as the company issues additional shares to them at no cost. Issuing of bonus shares further attaracts new investors to company.
